DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Internet Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Intervention Treating Insomnia
DOC.detailed_description: Insomnia disorder characterize perception complaint inadequate poor-quality sleep . Symptoms insomnia include difficulty fall asleep , wake frequently night difficulty return sleep , wake early morning , unrefreshing sleep . Insomnia may also cause problem day , tiredness , difficulty concentrating , irritability . Cognitive behavior therapy ( CBT ) find significant short- long-term benefit people insomnia . Access CBT many people , however , limited , due high cost treatment lack trained professional location . Delivering CBT via internet could help make treatment widely available . This study evaluate effectiveness online CBT intervention improve sleep , mood , cognitive functioning people insomnia . Participants open label study randomly assign receive online CBT intervention either immediately 4-month wait period . Participants use online program 1 2 hour per week 8 week . Participants keep track sleep pattern first last 2 week 4-month period keep daily diary wear wrist watch device monitor movement . All participant report study site baseline evaluation begin treatment final evaluation upon complete program , 4 month study entry .
DOC.criteria: Subjective complaint poor sleep Difficulties fall and/or stay asleep ( sleep onset latency and/or wake sleep onset great 30 minute ; sleep efficiency le 85 % ) Sleep difficulty least 3 night per week Sleep difficulty persist 6 month At least one daytime problem due poor sleep ( e.g. , fatigue , performance impairment , mood disturbance ) Daytime problem due sleep disturbance cause mark distress significant impairment social occupational functioning Has internet access Presence sleep disorder ( evaluate specific question structure interview ) ( e.g. , sleep apnea , periodic leg movement sleep , parasomnias ) Significant psychological distress ( include clinical depression anxiety ) , determine use Beck Depression Inventory ( BDI ) , STPI , Patient Health Questionnaire ( PHQ ) , clinical interview Substance use medical condition cause sleep problem Currently receive psychological treatment Taking medication stabilize 3 month prior study entry Regularly go sleep 2am wake 9am Shift worker
